decks.notes: The key concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting your opponent's strategy through targeted creature removal and hand disruption. By utilizing powerful creatures like Blood Baron of Vizkopa and Desecration Demon, along with control spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, you can control the pace of the game and outvalue your opponent. The inclusion of cards like Pack Rat and Whip of Erebos allows you to create additional threats and gain incremental advantage over time.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells and powerful creatures. The deck utilizes a combination of planeswalkers like Chandra, Pyromaster and Xenagos, the Reveler along with efficient creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Stormbreath Dragon to dominate the board. With a solid mana base and access to cards like Dreadbore, Rakdos's Return, and Abrupt Decay, the deck is designed to answer threats and maintain board control while applying pressure with its own threats.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Desecration Demon and Pack Rat while using cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's strategies. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Read the Bones to provide card advantage and consistency. By managing the opponent's threats and resources, the deck seeks to establish dominance and win the game through attrition.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using removal spells like Golgari Charm and Bile Blight, as well as hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize. The deck also focuses on generating card advantage and ramping up mana with cards like Nissa, Worldwaker and Underworld Connections. Its win conditions include powerful threats like Desecration Demon and Pack Rat, which can quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck has resilient creatures like Sylvan Caryatid and Scavenging Ooze to help stabilize against aggressive opponents.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures and aggressive plays. The key strategy involves utilizing mana ramp with Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to bring out high-impact threats like Xenagos, the Reveler and Nissa, Worldwaker early in the game. Cards like Mizzium Mortars and Ghor-Clan Rampager provide removal and combat tricks to maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and direct damage while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent using a combination of fast, low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Chandra's Phoenix and Young Pyromancer. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by quickly getting creatures on the board and using burn spells like Lightning Strike, Searing Blood, and Skullcrack to clear the way and keep the pressure on the opponent. Warleader's Helix and Stoke the Flames provide additional direct damage and removal options to secure the win.

This deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure by playing efficient creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Firedrinker Satyr, as well as using burn spells like Stoke the Flames and Lightning Strike to finish off the opponent. Young Pyromancer generates additional token creatures for more board presence, while Chandra's Phoenix provides a recurring threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and efficient threats. It aims to use cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Chandra, Pyromaster. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Xenagos, the Reveler and Nissa, Worldwaker to generate value and close out the game. Additionally, powerful threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Reaper of the Wilds provide a quick clock to pressure the opponent.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures, focusing on mono-blue cards. By utilizing cards like Judge's Familiar, Frostburn Weird, and Cloudfin Raptor, the deck aims to establish early board control and apply pressure. Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves provide additional power and resilience, while cards like Tidebinder Mage and Rapid Hybridization help disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some control elements like Aetherling and Domestication to handle threats and maintain momentum. Ultimately, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure victory through consistent aggression and adaptation.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive black creatures and disruptive spells while also maximizing devotion to black to take advantage of Gray Merchant of Asphodel's draining effect. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, while also generating card advantage with Underworld Connections. Additionally, Pack Rat and Mutavault provide additional threats and versatility. Ultimately, the deck's focus on aggressive black creatures and devotion to black allows it to consistently pressure the opponent and close out games quickly.

The primary focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to maintain control of the board through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Blood Baron of Vizkopa and Desecration Demon. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also being able to generate card advantage with Nightveil Specter and Pack Rat. The mana base includes lands that support both black and white mana sources, allowing for flexibility in casting spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. This UW Control deck aims to stabilize the board with removal spells like Planar Cleansing and Supreme Verdict, while generating card advantage with cards like Sphinx's Revelation. Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Jace, Architect of Thought serve as win conditions, while also providing additional value. The mana base is optimized for consistency, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the tempo of the game and outlasting the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and creatures to control the board and overpower the opponent. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid, then play threats like Courser of Kruphix and Polukranos, World Eater. Removal spells like Mizzium Mortars and Dreadbore help control the opponent's board while planeswalkers like Chandra, Pyromaster and Nissa, Worldwaker generate card advantage and create threats of their own. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through superior board presence and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Courser of Kruphix, allowing you to play powerful threats like Xenagos, the Reveler and Nissa, Worldwaker early on. The deck also includes removal spells like Dreadbore and Mizzium Mortars to control the board, while creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Ghor-Clan Rampager provide a strong beatdown strategy. The combination of ramp, removal, and big threats makes this deck a fast and aggressive choice in the Standard format.

The deck focuses on using aggressive red and white creatures like Young Pyromancer and Chandra's Phoenix to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Boros Charm, Lightning Strike, and Warleader's Helix to provide direct damage and removal of opposing threats. The deck aims to maintain board control with spells like Shock, Searing Blood, and Stoke the Flames while utilizing cards like Flames of the Firebrand and Mutavault for additional versatility and reach. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and finish off the opponent with direct burn spells.

This deck is focused on quickly deploying a lot of low-cost creatures with powerful abilities. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats while maintaining board control. The deck utilizes creatures with the ability to adapt and grow stronger, such as Cloudfin Raptor and Frostburn Weird. It also includes disruptive creatures like Judge's Familiar and Tidebinder Mage to control the opponent's plays. The addition of powerful planeswalker Jace, Architect of Thought and Thassa, God of the Sea provides additional card advantage and versatility. Additionally, the deck includes removal options with Rapid Hybridization and Domestication to deal with opposing threats.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By efficiently using burn spells such as Shock, Magma Jet, Lightning Strike, and Stoke the Flames, the deck aims to deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or life total. The creatures in the deck, such as Young Pyromancer, Goblin Rabblemaster, Chandra's Phoenix, and Firedrinker Satyr, provide additional pressure on the opponent and can quickly close out the game. The strategy revolves around relentless aggression and efficient removal to secure victory.

The key focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful black creatures while utilizing devotion to black to maximize their effects. Cards like Desecration Demon, Gray Merchant of Asphodel, Lifebane Zombie, and Pack Rat are all strong creatures that excel in an aggressive strategy. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Bile Blight to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, it incorporates card draw and card advantage through Underworld Connections and Sign in Blood, while removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Ultimate Price ensure control over the board.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Voyaging Satyr, allowing the player to play powerful threats such as Polukranos, World Eater and Genesis Hydra ahead of schedule. The deck also features a number of control elements like Sylvan Caryatid and Courser of Kruphix to help stabilize the board and keep the opponent's threats in check. With access to powerful planeswalkers like Xenagos, the Reveler and Nissa, Worldwaker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient mana ramping and powerful creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells and powerful planeswalkers to dominate the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid to ramp up mana, as well as cards like Mizzium Mortars and Dreadbore to deal with threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. With a mix of versatile threats like Xenagos, the Reveler and Nissa, Worldwaker, as well as flexible removal options like Putrefy and Rakdos's Return, this deck seeks to establish dominance and control the pace of the game.
